definitions: a person or thing that causes something to happen or develop more quickly

examples.text: the country has been the main accelerator of global growth for a decade

definitions: a venture or program that promotes and aids the rapid growth of selected new small businesses

examples.text: an accelerator for start-up technology companies in Buenos Aires
a record number of women-led start-ups are participating in the accelerator program

shortDefinitions: venture that promotes growth of new businesses

definitions: a device, typically a pedal, that controls the speed of a vehicle's engine

examples.text: he pressed the accelerator to the floor and the taxi shot forward
the bank will have its foot on the accelerator until the economy starts to recover

shortDefinitions: device which controls speed of vehicle's engine

definitions: an apparatus for accelerating charged particles to high velocities; a particle accelerator
shortDefinitions: apparatus for accelerating charged particles to high velocities

definitions: a substance that speeds up a chemical process.
shortDefinitions: substance that speeds up chemical process
